ygData.msgSnippet: We seemed to have found the bug that caused this problem.  We run heritrix in an integrated software solution.  So its run via API with a command line like

Subject: Re: Heritrix 1.4 not shutting down
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=186379482; y=jsvoeq6zY3c-WoJt_9vI-gkwnyq3bHLt78QCy4FYezxBl24

We seemed to have found the bug that caused this problem.  We run 
heritrix in an integrated software solution.  So its run via API 
with a command line like interface.  
When upgrading to 1.4 Heritrix added this 
ThreadLocalHttpConnectionManager.  It stays running and keeps the 
whole application up, whereas the application stopped when the crawl 
was completed in the previous version.  
Setting a daemon thread solves the problem and doesn't seem to have 
any consequences.  I suggest a bug fix in which this is set to be a 
daemon thread.  Thanks.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> jirleech wrote:
> 
> > We are in the process of upgrading to Heritrix 1.4 and we've 
noticed
> > that when when the crawl completes and the logging status says
> > complete, the app never seems to exit or shutdown.  Any 
thoughts? 
> > Thanks.
> 
> After finishing a crawl, Heritrix waits around unless you 
explicitly ask 
> it to shutdown via 'Shut down Heritrix software' link on main 
index 
> page.  Are you suggesting that you are hitting the shutdown link 
and its 
> not going down for you?
> Yours,
> St.Ack
> 
> >
> >
